title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: How Hurricane Melissa Got So Intense, and a ‘Plan’ for a Third Trump Term

items.title: MacKenzie Scott Backs Disaster Recovery in Marginalized Communities
items.description: The billionaire’s $60 million donation to the Center for Disaster Philanthropy counters cuts to federal emergency assistance and diversity programs.

items.title: Melissa’s Powerful Winds Could Be Even Worse in Jamaica’s Mountains
items.description: Gusts in higher elevations could be up to 30 percent stronger, the National Hurricane Center said.

items.title: Memo From Bill Gates Warns Against Climate Alarmism
items.description: In a memo, the Microsoft co-founder warned against climate alarmism and appears to have shifted some of his views about climate change.

items.title: OpenAI Restructures as For-Profit Company
items.description: The artificial intelligence company said that the nonprofit that controlled the organization would receive a $130 billion stake in the new company.

items.title: Volunteers foster literacy by reading to children and giving them books
items.description: Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.

items.title: America's immigration crackdown is disrupting the global remittance market
items.description: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.

items.title: Trump’s Feud With Colombian Leader Threatens U.S. Antidrug Efforts
items.description: President Trump said he is cutting U.S. aid. Gustavo Petro, a leftist guerrilla turned president, has called Mr. Trump’s boat strikes murder.

items.title: As Trump Tariffs Canada, Carney Turns to Asia for Trade
items.description: Mark Carney is pitching Canada as a predictable and responsible alternative to the United States.

items.title: On the Menu for Trump in Tokyo: American Rice
items.description: Rice is a point of pride in Japan, and the choice was a break from the typical diplomatic practice of showcasing local ingredients.
